attributes.action: Amend the Mobile Homes Act 1983 to improve the situation regarding occupiers the right to sell their homes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The park owner is not entitled to demand an interview with the person buying the home before giving approval but where he believes that an interview is necessary, the interview must be conducted in an office of a lawyer with a lawyer present. The lawyer must satisfy himself that the reasons for the interview are reasonable, that statements made by the park owner are not fraudulent and references offered by the person are satisfactory. References deemed satisfactory to the lawyer shall be acceptable to the park owner. A lawyer for the purposes of the above must be a lawyer with a registered legal practice. The lawyer chosen shall be acceptable to both parties and shall make himself aware of the content of the Mobile Homes Act 1983 and associated legislation before the interview. The charge for the lawyer's services shall be met by the park owner.
